candidates.title: Le big rewrite
candidates.body:
A rewrite using async and Hyper with full support for multi-threaded test runs, multiple servers/endpoints and other goodies.

The old interface will still be accessible in this version, but will be marked as deprecated, since it still relies on the locking mechanism.

Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/92 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/94 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/144 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/150

Potentially closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/111 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/140 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/147

TODO:

- [x] Document the server
- [x] Add an HTTP2 test
- [x] Introduce an Error type
- [x] Check for unnecessary unwraps
- [x] Update the README
- [x] Update/remove the benchmark test
- [x] Introduce an error context

candidates.title: Replace difference library with similar
candidates.body:
Replace difference library with similar because difference is no longer
maintained. See advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0095

Updated related tests due to slightly different diffing output.

Fixes #132

candidates.title: Update assert-json-diff to 2.0.0
candidates.body: I recently released assert-json-diff 2.0.0 which had [a few breaking changes](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200---2021-01-23).

candidates.title: Upgrade deps
candidates.body:
> mockito$ cargo upgrades
> All dependencies are up to date!

candidates.title: fix: use serde_urlencoded for query matching
candidates.body:
This is a fix that resolves #121 and also comes with a slightly leaner implementation of `Matcher::UrlEncoded`'s match arm in `Matcher::matches_value`

Open to any feedback / suggestions!

candidates.title: Warnings on missing .create()
candidates.body: As discussed in #112

candidates.title: Prefer assert_json_include_no_panic over deprecated version
candidates.body:
Closes #109 

Closes https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/issues/13

candidates.title: Bump dependency
candidates.body: Also `^` in Cargo doesn't do anything (it's the default behavior)

candidates.title: use the Rust 2018 edition
candidates.body: I have just done the minimum steps outlined in the [Edition guide](https://doc.rust-lang.org/edition-guide/editions/transitioning-an-existing-project-to-a-new-edition.html#updating-your-code-to-be-compatible-with-the-new-edition) without edition idiom migration

candidates.title: Move colored diff output to feature flag
candidates.body:
This allows one to use  this crate without bringing in the pretty big `colored` crate dependency and for when colored text diffs are not important.

The new `color` feature flag is enabled by default so no change in the default behavior

candidates.title: adds PartialJson and PartialJsonString matchers
candidates.body:
This PR adds the ability to match partially a json body.
I've included the [assert_json_diff](https://crates.io/crates/assert-json-diff) library that does just that, verify that a json is "included" in another.

candidates.title: Introduce Matcher::UrlEncoded to match url encoded data - especially query parameters
Bump dependencies (rand) and increase the minimum supported toolchain version
candidates.body: Closes #73

candidates.title: Few fixes needed when packaging for Fedora
Use the log crate instead of own logger
candidates.body: The `log` crate is a de-facto standard, and this helps integrate with other logger outputs.

candidates.title: Fix Windows build and doctest failures.
candidates.body:
Fixes #41 and #36

Substitute [http_muncher] with [httparse]

candidates.title: Update dependencies
candidates.body:
The update was simple and just had to fix few warnings.

 - lazy_static
 - rand
 - regex

Signed-off-by: Otavio Salvador <otavio@ossystems.com.br>

candidates.title: Produce a colored diff whenever Mock::assert() errors
candidates.body: Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/23

candidates.title: Bump version of serde_json
candidates.body: Fixes #30

candidates.title: Added `Matcher::JSON` to match json bodies.
candidates.body:
This is helpful in scenarios where the posted body is expected to be a
JSON document. Since the order of keys in a JSON document is not
guaranteed it is required to compare the paresed representation.

candidates.title: basic regex support
candidates.body:
Hi!
I want a regex support to mock URL path.
This is my vision how to add it. I`m newbie in rust.

Regex used by default for all paths. This is a breaking change...
And `mock("/ab")` will match `/abcd`.

Sorry for my poor English.

candidates.title: cargo: update serde suite to v1
Change usage of rustc_serialize to serde
candidates.body: I'm interested in adding support for users to match mocks based on the request body. This PR makes that a little bit easier. Are you interested in that feature?

candidates.title: Bump hyper version to 0.10.0
candidates.body:
According to the changelog on Hyper non of the breaking changes should
cause issues with this crate.

https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/v0.10.4/CHANGELOG.md#breaking-changes-1

According to the changelog on Hyper non of the breaking changes should
